name: Coontail

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: fork-divided only once or twice, whorls of 5-12, relatively stiff even out of water, flattened, finely serrated (tiny teetch tipped with sharp spines)
Flowers:  June-September, minute in leaf axils
Fruits/Seeds: fruits on female plants only, smooth with two spines at base
Habitat: Tolerates cool temperatures and low light
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, United States

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
